commands.name: Ping
commands.description: Checks if Synthesis is alive and responding
commands.use_cases: Health checks, verify connection, test bridge is active
commands.common_errors: No response - Bridge not initialized or Unity not in Play mode

commands.name: FindGameObject
commands.description: Finds a GameObject in active scene by name
commands.use_cases: Locate objects before manipulation, verify object exists, get references
commands.common_errors: GameObject not found - Name is case-sensitive and must be exact

commands.name: SetComponentValue
commands.description: Sets a field or property value on a component
commands.use_cases: Move objects, change UI properties, update component values in real-time
commands.common_errors: Type mismatch - Value type must match field type exactly

workflows.title: Move UI Element
workflows.description: Reposition a UI element to new screen coordinates

workflows.title: Batch Update Button Colors
workflows.description: Change color of multiple UI buttons

steps.note: Repeat for each button found in hierarchy

examples.title: Find and Move Player
examples.description: Locate player object and change position

faqs.question: Why isn't Synthesis responding to commands?
faqs.answer:
Check these common issues:

1. Unity must be in Play mode
2. 'Enable Bridge' must be checked on Synthesis component
3. Wait at least 0.5 seconds between command and result
4. Check synthesis_logs.txt for errors
5. Verify JSON syntax is valid
6. Ensure files are in project root folder
faqs.keywords: not working, not responding, no response

faqs.question: How do I find the objectId for a GameObject?
faqs.answer:
Use the FindGameObject command first:

1. Send FindGameObject command with the object name
2. Check the response - objectId is in the 'data' field
3. Use that objectId in subsequent commands

Example:
{"command":"FindGameObject","parameters":{"name":"Player"}}
Response will contain: {"data":{"objectId":"12345",...}}

faqs.question: Can I modify objects outside Play mode?
faqs.answer:
No, Synthesis only works during Play mode for safety reasons. This prevents accidental permanent changes to scenes/prefabs.

However, you can:
1. Use the Persistence System (UIChangeLog) to save runtime changes
2. Changes are automatically applied when exiting Play mode
3. This gives you the safety of testing in Play mode with the convenience of permanent edits
faqs.keywords: edit mode, play mode, when to use

faqs.question: What component types can I modify?
faqs.answer:
You can modify any MonoBehaviour component! Common types:

Transform: position, rotation, scale
RectTransform: anchoredPosition, sizeDelta
UnityEngine.UI.Image: color, sprite
UnityEngine.UI.Text: text, fontSize, color
TMPro.TextMeshProUGUI: text, fontSize, color
Rigidbody: velocity, mass
Camera: fieldOfView, backgroundColor

Use the full namespace (e.g., 'TMPro.TextMeshProUGUI' not just 'TextMeshProUGUI')

faqs.question: How do I use Synthesis with AI assistants?
faqs.answer:
Synthesis is designed for AI integration:

1. AI writes command to synthesis_commands.json
2. Unity reads and executes (every 0.5s)
3. AI reads result from synthesis_results.json

Works great with:
- Cursor AI (built-in file access)
- Claude/ChatGPT via MCP
- Python/JavaScript scripts
- Custom automation tools

For real-time: Use HTTP server mode (port 8765)

errors.cause: No GameObject with specified name exists in active scene
errors.solution:
1. Verify object name is exact (case-sensitive)
2. Check object is in active scene
3. Use GetHierarchy to see all available objects
4. Check object isn't disabled/inactive

errors.cause: Specified component type doesn't exist on GameObject
errors.solution:
1. Use GetComponent to see available components
2. Check component type spelling
3. Use full namespace (e.g., 'UnityEngine.UI.Image')
4. Verify component is attached in Inspector

errors.cause: Specified field/property doesn't exist on component
errors.solution:
1. Use GetComponent to see available fields
2. Check field name spelling (case-sensitive)
3. Verify field is public or has public property
4. Check Unity documentation for component

errors.cause: Value type doesn't match field type
errors.solution:
1. Check field type with GetComponentValue
2. Use correct JSON format:
   - Vector3: {"x":1,"y":2,"z":3}
   - Color: {"r":1,"g":0,"b":0,"a":1}
   - Float: 3.14
   - String: "text"
3. Don't use quotes for numbers

errors.error_message: Bridge only works in Play mode
errors.cause: Attempted to use bridge while Unity is in Edit mode
errors.solution:
1. Press Play button in Unity
2. Wait for scene to load
3. Try command again
4. For Edit mode changes, use Persistence System
